The ceasefire largely held for three consecutive weeks. The SMM recorded relatively low levels of ceasefire violations in the Donetsk and Luhansk regions.

On 7-9 September, the SMM held a three-day training course on dialogue facilitation for young people in Kyiv. Learn more about the Youth Contact Group, a youth-for- dialogue network launched recently by the SMM, here: http://bit.ly/YouthContactGroup

On 10-11 September, the SMM Chief Monitor Ertugrul Apakan and the OSCE Secretary General Lamberto Zannier visited southern Donetsk region to assess the security and humanitarian situation. Zannier welcomed the emerging calm and expressed hope for progress on the political level to end the fighting.

On 18 September, the SMM presented its latest thematic report “Access to water in conflict‐affected areas of Donetsk and Luhansk regions”. It examines the negative impact of the conflict on access to water and SMM’s efforts to facilitate local ceasefires to allow for the repairs to provide conflict‐affected civilians with sufficient, safe, acceptable and affordable water. Full report is available here: www.osce.org/ukraine-smm/183151

Starting from 20 September the SMM observed tensions but no incidents during the blockade of cargo trucks at three crossing points to Crimea.

On 22 September Chief Monitor Apakan and Deputy Chief Monitor Alexander Hug took part in meetings of the Trilateral Contact Group’s Working Group on Security in Minsk, which the SMM co-ordinates.

Starting from 22 September the SMM helped facilitate access for the “International Committee of the Red Cross” to be able to deliver humanitarian aid to villages in the Donetsk region. “Joint Centre for Control and Co-ordination” guaranteed the respect of ceasefire.
